009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
019
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
023import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
024import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
025
026
027/**
028 * Implements a 2-dimensional Procrustes fit, using the algorithm described in 
029 * Shinji Umeyama, "Least-squares estimation of transformation parameters 
030 * between two point patterns", IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and 
031 * Machine Intelligence 13.4 (Apr. 1991), pp. 376â€“380.
032 * Usage example (also see the {@code main()} method of this class):
033 * <pre>
034 * Point[] P = ... // create sequence of 2D source points
035 * Point[] Q = ... // create sequence of 2D target points
036 * ProcrustesFit pf = new ProcrustesFit(P, Q);
037 * double err = pf.getError();
038 * RealMatrix R = pf.getR();
039 * RealVector t = pf.getT();
040 * double s = pf.getScale();
041 * double err = pf.getError();
042 * RealMatrix A = pf.getTransformationMatrix();
043 * </pre>
044 * 
045 * @author WB
046 * @version 2021/11/27
047 */
048public class ProcrustesFit implements LinearFit2D {
049        
050        private final RealMatrix R;                                     // orthogonal (rotation) matrix
051        private final RealVector t;                                     // translation vector
052        private final double s;                                         // uniform scale
053        
054        private final RealMatrix A;                                     // resulting transformation matrix
055        private final double err;                                       // RMS fitting error
056        
057        // --------------------------------------------------------------
058        
059        /**
060         * Convenience constructor, with
061         * parameters {@code allowTranslation}, {@code allowScaling} and {@code forceRotation}
062         * set to {@code true}.
063         * @param P the source points
064         * @param Q the target points
065         */
066        public ProcrustesFit(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
067                this(P, Q, true, true, true);
068        }
069        
070        /**
071         * Full constructor.
072         * @param P the first point sequence
073         * @param Q the second point sequence
074         * @param allowTranslation if {@code true}, translation (t) between point sets is considered, 
075         *              otherwise zero translation is assumed
076         * @param allowScaling if {@code true}, scaling (s) between point sets is considered, 
077         *              otherwise unit scale assumed
078         * @param forceRotation if {@code true}, the orthogonal part of the transformation (Q)
079         *              is forced to a true rotation and no reflection is allowed
080         */
081        public ProcrustesFit(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q, boolean allowTranslation, boolean allowScaling, boolean forceRotation) {
082                checkSize(P, Q);
083                
084                double[] meanP = null;
085                double[] meanY = null;
086                
087                if (allowTranslation) {
088                        meanP = getMeanVec(P);
089                        meanY = getMeanVec(Q);
090                }
091                
092                RealMatrix vP = makeDataMatrix(P, meanP);
093                RealMatrix vQ = makeDataMatrix(Q, meanY);
094                MatrixUtils.checkAdditionCompatible(vP, vQ);    // P, Q of same dimensions?
095                
096                RealMatrix QPt = vQ.multiply(vP.transpose());
097                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(QPt);
098                
099                RealMatrix U = svd.getU();
100                RealMatrix S = svd.getS();
101                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
102                        
103                double d = (svd.getRank() >= 2) ? det(QPt) : det(U) * det(V);
104                
105                RealMatrix D = MatrixUtils.createRealIdentityMatrix(2);
106                if (d < 0 && forceRotation)
107                        D.setEntry(1, 1, -1);
108                
109                R = U.multiply(D).multiply(V.transpose());
110                
111                double normP = vP.getFrobeniusNorm();
112                double normQ = vQ.getFrobeniusNorm();
113                
114                s = (allowScaling) ? 
115                                S.multiply(D).getTrace() / sqr(normP) : 1.0;
116                
117                if (allowTranslation) {
118                        RealVector ma = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(meanP);
119                        RealVector mb = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(meanY);
120                        t = mb.subtract(R.scalarMultiply(s).operate(ma));
121                }
122                else {
123                        t = new ArrayRealVector(2);     // zero vector
124                }
125                
126                // make the transformation matrix A
127                RealMatrix cR = R.scalarMultiply(s);
128                A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2, 3);
129                A.setSubMatrix(cR.getData(), 0, 0);
130                A.setColumnVector(2, t);
131                
132                // calculate the fitting error:
133                err = Math.sqrt(sqr(normQ) - sqr(S.multiply(D).getTrace() / normP));    
134        }
135        
136        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
137        
138        /**
139         * Retrieves the estimated scale.
140         * @return The estimated scale (or 1 if {@code allowscaling = false}).
141         */
142        public double getScale() {
143                return s;
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Retrieves the estimated orthogonal (rotation) matrix.
148         * @return The estimated rotation matrix.
149         */
150        public double[][] getR() {
151                return R.getData();
152        }
153        
154        /**
155         * Retrieves the estimated translation vector.
156         * @return The estimated translation vector.
157         */
158        public double[] getT() {
159                return t.toArray();
160        }
161        
162        // --------------------------------------------------------
163        
164        @Override
165        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
166                return A.getData();
167//              return A;
168        }
169        
170        @Override
171        public double getError() {
172                return err;
173        }
174        
175        /**
176         * Calculates the total error for the estimated fit as
177         * the sum of the squared Euclidean distances between the 
178         * transformed point set X and the reference set Y.
179         * This method is provided for testing as an alternative to
180         * the quicker {@link getError} method.
181         * @param P Sequence of n-dimensional points.
182         * @param Q Sequence of n-dimensional points (reference).
183         * @return The total error for the estimated fit.
184         */
185        private double getEuclideanError(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
186                int m = Math.min(P.length,  Q.length);
187                RealMatrix sR = R.scalarMultiply(s);
188                double errSum = 0;
189                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
190                        RealVector p = new ArrayRealVector(P[i].toDoubleArray());
191                        RealVector q = new ArrayRealVector(Q[i].toDoubleArray());
192                        RealVector pp = sR.operate(p).add(t);
193                        //System.out.format("p=%s, q=%s, pp=%s\n", p.toString(), q.toString(), pp.toString());
194                        double e = pp.subtract(q).getNorm();
195                        errSum = errSum + e * e;
196                }
197                return Math.sqrt(errSum);       // correct!
198        }
199        
200        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
201        
202        private double det(RealMatrix M) {
203                return new LUDecomposition(M).getDeterminant();
204        }
205        
206        private double[] getMeanVec(Pnt2d[] points) {
207                double sumX = 0;
208                double sumY = 0;
209                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
210                        sumX = sumX + p.getX();
211                        sumY = sumY + p.getY();
212                }
213                return new double[] {sumX / points.length, sumY / points.length};
214        }
215        
216        private RealMatrix makeDataMatrix(Pnt2d[] points, double[] meanX) {
217                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2, points.length);
218                RealVector mean = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(meanX);
219                int i = 0;
220                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
221                        RealVector cv = p.toRealVector();
222//                      RealVector cv = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(p.toDoubleArray());
223                        if (meanX != null) {
224                                cv = cv.subtract(mean);
225                        }
226                        M.setColumnVector(i, cv);
227                        i++;
228                }
229                return M;
230        }
231        
232//      private void printSVD(SingularValueDecomposition svd) {
233//              RealMatrix U = svd.getU();
234//              RealMatrix S = svd.getS();
235//              RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
236//              System.out.println("------ SVD ---------------");
237//              System.out.println("U = " + Matrix.toString(U.getData()));
238//              System.out.println("S = " + Matrix.toString(S.getData()));
239//              System.out.println("V = " + Matrix.toString(V.getData()));
240//              System.out.println("--------------------------");
241//      }
242        
243        
244        private void checkSize(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
245                if (P.length < 3 || Q.length < 3) {
246                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least 3 point pairs are required to calculate this fit");
247                }
248        }
249
250        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
251        
252        private static double roundToDigits(double x, int ndigits) {
253                int d = (int) Math.pow(10, ndigits);
254                return Math.rint(x * d) / d;
255        }
256
257        public static void main(String[] args) {
258                PrintPrecision.set(6);
259                int NDIGITS = 1;
260                
261                boolean allowTranslation = true;
262                boolean allowScaling = true;
263                boolean forceRotation = true;
264                
265                double a = 0.6;
266                double[][] R0data =
267                        {{ Math.cos(a), -Math.sin(a) },
268                         { Math.sin(a),  Math.cos(a) }};
269                
270                RealMatrix R0 = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(R0data);
271                double[] t0 = {4, -3};
272                double s = 3.5;
273                
274                System.out.format("original alpha: a = %.6f\n", a);
275                System.out.println("original rotation: R = \n" + Matrix.toString(R0.getData()));
276                System.out.println("original translation: t = " + Matrix.toString(t0));
277                System.out.format("original scale: s = %.6f\n", s);
278                System.out.println();
279                
280                Pnt2d[] P = {
281                                PntInt.from(2, 5),
282                                PntInt.from(7, 3),
283                                PntInt.from(0, 9),
284                                PntInt.from(5, 4)
285                };
286                
287                Pnt2d[] Q = new Pnt2d[P.length];
288                
289                for (int i = 0; i < P.length; i++) {
290                        Pnt2d q = PntDouble.from(R0.operate(P[i].toDoubleArray()));
291                        // noise!
292                        double qx = roundToDigits(s * q.getX() + t0[0], NDIGITS);
293                        double qy = roundToDigits(s * q.getY() + t0[1], NDIGITS);
294                        Q[i] = Pnt2d.PntDouble.from(qx, qy);
295                }
296                
297                //P[0] = Point.create(2, 0);    // to provoke a large error
298                
299                ProcrustesFit pf = new ProcrustesFit(P, Q, allowTranslation, allowScaling, forceRotation);
300
301                double[][] R = pf.getR();
302                System.out.format("estimated alpha: a = %.6f\n", Math.acos(R[0][0]));
303                System.out.println("estimated rotation: R = \n" + Matrix.toString(R));
304                double[] T = pf.getT();
305                System.out.println("estimated translation: t = " + Matrix.toString(T));
306                System.out.format("estimated scale: s = %.6f\n", pf.getScale());
307                
308                System.out.println();
309                System.out.format("RMS fitting error = %.6f\n", pf.getError());
310                System.out.format("euclidean error (test) = %.6f\n", pf.getEuclideanError(P, Q));
311                
312                double[][] A = pf.getTransformationMatrix();
313                System.out.println("transformation matrix: A = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
314        }
315
316        /*
317        original alpha: a = 0.600000
318        original rotation: R = 
319        {{0.825336, -0.564642}, 
320        {0.564642, 0.825336}}
321        original translation: t = {4.000000, -3.000000}
322        original scale: s = 3.500000
323        
324        estimated alpha: a = 0.599589
325        estimated rotation: R = 
326        {{0.825568, -0.564303}, 
327        {0.564303, 0.825568}}
328        estimated translation: t = {3.980905, -3.011055}
329        estimated scale: s = 3.500560
330        
331        fitting error = 0.048079
332        euclidean error (test) = 0.048079
333        transformation matrix: A = 
334        {{2.889950, -1.975377, 3.980905}, 
335        {1.975377, 2.889950, -3.011055}}
336         */
337}
